meanings.definition: A loud, sharp cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The yoop of the baby woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent2: I heard a yoop coming from the forest.
meanings.sent3: The yoop of the monkey made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her yoop echoed through the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The yoop of the fire alarm was ear-piercing.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, sharp cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: She likes to yoop when she's excited.
meanings.sent2: Please don't yoop in the library.
meanings.sent3: The children yooped with joy when they won the game.
meanings.sent4: The singer yooped into the microphone with passion.
meanings.sent5: He yooped so loudly that the neighbors complained.

meanings.definition: A person who is loud and boisterous.
meanings.sent1: Tom is such a yoop at parties.
meanings.sent2: The yoop at the concert was dancing wildly.
meanings.sent3: The little yoop entertained everyone with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: She's a real yoop when she gets excited.
meanings.sent5: The yoop's laughter filled the room.
